abstract: Most of the exchanges across Asia rebounded modestly on Wednesday after two days of sharp declines in response to fears of an American recession.
snippet: Most of the exchanges across Asia rebounded modestly on Wednesday after two days of sharp declines in response to fears of an American recession.
lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI  The calm seemed to return to markets across Asian on Wednesday morning.

headline.main: Asian Markets Ease Higher After Losses
headline.print_headline: Asian Markets Endure 2 Brutal Days of Plunges

byline.original: By David Barboza and Heather Timmons

abstract: The stark sell-off that sent global stock prices plummeting  brought renewed concern that the equity markets in China and India might be overvalued.
snippet: The stark sell-off that sent global stock prices plummeting  brought renewed concern that the equity markets in China and India might be overvalued.
lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI  The stark sell-off that sent share prices plummeting around the world early this week brought renewed concern that the equity markets in China and India might be overvalued. But while Chinese investors and analysts worried this might be the case and fretted over the potential social consequences, in India the market chaos was often greeted as a buying opportunity.

headline.main: Asian Markets Endure 2 Brutal Days of Plunges
headline.print_headline: Asian Markets Endure 2 Brutal Days of Plunges

byline.original: By David Barboza and Heather Timmons
